LEXSense.DefinitionShort: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= marker indicating that even if the event in focus is true, another event can take place

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
= set of particles marking an object or event as opposed to other objects and events
= particle marking an event that one wishes to happen

Glosses.Gloss: if only ... (I would be so happy!)

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: = particle marking an oath or a similar strongly worded statement
= set of particles linking two events and denoting that X will not takes place unless Y is true
= set of particles marking an object or event as a subset of a larger group which has been singled out from among the rest
= set of particles linking two events and denoting that X will continue up to the moment that Y has taken place
